title: Create Virtual Private Cloud
content:
Role Location
IT / Network administrator GCP Console

To deploy OMT and the suite on GCP, you need to prepare Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) first and place the other resources in this prepared VPC. To create VPC on GCP, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the Google Cloud Platform Console at https://console.cloud.google.com/.
  2. Click VPC network > VPC networks > CREATE VPC NETWORK.
  3. Give a name to this VPC.
  4. Under the Subnets node, you can customize subnet settings including name, region, and IP range. You may create two subnets: one for the Kubernetes cluster and the other for the bastion node. For example, 10.49.0.0/24 for the bastion node and 10.2.0.0/24 for the Kubernetes cluster.
     
    Some regions don't support the availability of all required resources. We recommend that you read the instructions at Geographic distribution of GCP before you select a region.
  5. Click CREATE to save the configurations.

Once VPC is created successfully, you can go back to the VPC networks panel to view and edit the created VPC's settings.

Enable Cloud NAT for outbound traffic

We recommend that you use a private GKE cluster where worker nodes don't have public IPs for security considerations. But in some scenarios, you might need to enable certain services inside the cluster to connect to the Internet (for example, the cluster needs to access an email server). In such cases, you can provision a Cloud NAT to set up outbound traffic for the cluster:

  1. Log in to the Google Cloud Platform Console at https://console.cloud.google.com/.
  2. Click Network services > Cloud NAT > CREATE CLOUD NAT GATEWAY.
  3. Give a name to the gateway and populate the following fields:
    • VPC network: Select the prepared VPC.
    • Region: Select the same region as the VPC.
    • Cloud Router: Create a new router if no router is available.
  4. Leave the remaining settings as is and click Create.

For VPC information, see VPC Network.
